pr_title: GEODE-8351: DUnit tests for Delta Propagation

timeline.message: GEODE-8351: DUnit tests for Delta Propagation

timeline.bodyText: I think you want this to be "append" instead of "set".
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: instead of SET_SIZE in this context should be something like APPEND_COUNT?
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: Thank you, meant to change that.
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: extract this chunk of code that into a single method that checks that the primary and secondary are consistent.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: It seems like you could write it in a way that it is the same for each test. You really don't care in this test what is in each server; just that whatever one server has the other does also.
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: That is true. I made a generic method for getting the local region and getting the correct data.  I'm not sure how much further we could go without sacrificing readability?
replies.author: sabbey37

timeline.bodyText: Instead of using the RedisData's toString (which might not show all fields) try converting it to a byte array. You can use BlobHelper.serializeToBlob and then have this return the byte array. Then use the JDK Arrays.equals(byte[], byte[]) to see if they are equal. If they are not you will want to use BlobHelper.deserializeBlob(byte[]) to report the objects that are not equal.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: key is unused since it is captured by the lambdas and not used anywhere else other than the function being passed in. Don't worry about changing it unless there is something else you happen to also change before we merge in.
timeline.author: jdeppe-pivotal
